zone.line: I did not weep, but I wiped the perpi
-ration from my brow, and tried to
still my brain and heart beating
almost to madness. Oh! I must not
be mad when I see him; or perhaps it
were as well that I should be, my
distraction might calm him ^his, and
recall him to the endurance of
life. Yet untill I find him I must
force reason to keep her seat, and I
pressed my forehead hard with my
hands – Oh do not leave me; or I
shall forget what I am about – in
sbea stead of driving on as we ought
with the speed of lightning they will
attend to me, and we shall be too
late. Oh! God help me! Let him be
alive! It is all I ask; in my abject
misery I demand no more: no hope,
no good: only passion, and guilt, and
horror; but alive! Alive! My sensations
